intro: Acer mandshuricum subsp. kansuense, commonly known as the Kansu maple, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves that turn vibrant red in the autumn. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and thrives in temperate climates. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, appearing in early spring before the leaves emerge. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
